tasks.title: Setup Project Repository and Development Environment
tasks.description: Initialize the project repository with Next.js 14, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS. Set up a local Docker development environment.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new GitHub repository named 'petlog'
2. Initialize Next.js 14 project with TypeScript:
   npx create-next-app@latest petlog --typescript
3. Install TailwindCSS:
   npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer
   npx tailwindcss init -p
4. Set up Docker for local development:
   - Create Dockerfile and docker-compose.yml
   - Include services for Next.js, Go API, and MongoDB
5. Set up VSCode with recommended extensions (ESLint, Prettier, Docker)
6. Initialize Go modules and create basic project structure following Clean Architecture
tasks.testStrategy: Verify that the development environment can be started with Docker Compose and that Next.js, Go API, and MongoDB services are running correctly.

subtasks.title: Initialize GitHub Repository and Next.js Project
subtasks.description: Create a new GitHub repository and set up a Next.js 14 project with TypeScript
subtasks.details:
1. Create a new GitHub repository named 'petlog'
2. Clone the repository locally
3. Run 'npx create-next-app@latest petlog --typescript'
4. Push the initial commit to GitHub
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the repository is created on GitHub and the Next.js project structure is present locally

subtasks.title: Install and Configure TailwindCSS
subtasks.description: Add TailwindCSS to the Next.js project and set up the necessary configuration
subtasks.details:
1. Run 'npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer'
2. Execute 'npx tailwindcss init -p'
3. Configure Tailwind by updating tailwind.config.js and globals.css
subtasks.testStrategy: Create a sample component using Tailwind classes and verify styling is applied correctly

subtasks.title: Set Up Docker Development Environment
subtasks.description: Create Docker configuration for local development including Next.js, Go API, and MongoDB services
subtasks.details:
1. Create a Dockerfile for the Next.js application
2. Create a docker-compose.yml file with services for Next.js, Go API, and MongoDB
3. Configure environment variables and network settings
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'docker-compose up' and verify all services start without errors

subtasks.title: Configure VSCode with Recommended Extensions
subtasks.description: Set up Visual Studio Code with ESLint, Prettier, and Docker extensions
subtasks.details:
1. Install ESLint, Prettier, and Docker extensions in VSCode
2. Create .vscode/extensions.json with recommended extensions
3. Set up ESLint and Prettier configuration files
subtasks.testStrategy: Open the project in VSCode and verify all recommended extensions are installed and functioning

subtasks.title: Initialize Go API Project Structure
subtasks.description: Set up the Go API project following Clean Architecture principles
subtasks.details:
1. Initialize Go modules with 'go mod init github.com/yourusername/petlog-api'
2. Create directory structure: cmd, internal, pkg
3. Set up basic main.go file in cmd/api
4. Implement initial Clean Architecture layers: domain, usecase, repository, delivery
subtasks.testStrategy: Run 'go build ./...' and ensure the project compiles without errors

tasks.title: Implement User Authentication
tasks.description: Implement user authentication using Auth0 for both backend and frontend integration.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Auth0 account and configure application settings
2. Integrate Auth0 SDK with Go backend:
   - Configure Auth0 application settings for API
   - Implement JWT verification middleware using Auth0 libraries
   - Set up necessary environment variables and configuration
3. Integrate Auth0 SDK with Next.js frontend:
   - Install and configure Auth0 React SDK
   - Implement login, logout, and user profile functionality
   - Handle authentication state and protected routes
4. Implement proper error handling for authentication failures
5. Set up proper CORS and security configurations
6. Configure Auth0 Rules or Actions for custom claims if needed
tasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for Auth0 integration. Implement integration tests for authentication flows. Test token verification middleware. Create end-to-end tests for login, logout, and protected routes.

subtasks.title: Set Up Auth0 Account and Application
subtasks.description: Create and configure Auth0 account with appropriate application settings for our project.
subtasks.details: Create Auth0 account. Set up a new application in Auth0 dashboard. Configure callback URLs, logout URLs, and allowed web origins. Set up API settings and permissions. Document all credentials and configuration details securely.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that the Auth0 application is properly configured by testing login flow manually before implementation.

subtasks.title: Integrate Auth0 with Go Backend
subtasks.description: Implement Auth0 integration with the Go backend for JWT verification and protected routes.
subtasks.details: Install Auth0 Go SDK or appropriate JWT libraries. Configure middleware to validate Auth0-issued JWTs. Set up environment variables for Auth0 domain, audience, and other required settings. Implement error handling for authentication failures.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for JWT verification middleware. Create integration tests to ensure protected routes properly validate Auth0 tokens.

subtasks.title: Implement JWT Verification Middleware
subtasks.description: Create middleware to verify Auth0-issued JWT tokens for protected routes.
subtasks.details: Develop middleware that extracts JWT from the Authorization header. Verify token signature and expiration using Auth0 public keys. Attach user information to the request context. Handle various authentication error scenarios gracefully.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for token extraction and verification. Create integration tests with protected routes to ensure proper middleware functionality.

subtasks.title: Integrate Auth0 with Next.js Frontend
subtasks.description: Implement Auth0 authentication in the Next.js frontend application.
subtasks.details: Install Auth0 React SDK (@auth0/auth0-react). Configure Auth0Provider with appropriate settings. Create login and logout buttons. Implement protected routes using authentication state. Handle authentication callbacks and redirects.
subtasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for authentication components. Create integration tests to verify login, logout, and protected route functionality.

subtasks.title: Implement User Profile and Token Management
subtasks.description: Handle user profile information and token management in the frontend application.
subtasks.details: Retrieve and display user profile information from Auth0. Implement proper token storage and renewal. Handle session expiration gracefully. Create user profile components to display user information.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test user profile retrieval and display. Verify token renewal functionality. Test session expiration handling.

subtasks.title: Configure Auth0 Rules or Actions
subtasks.description: Set up custom Auth0 Rules or Actions for additional authentication logic if needed.
subtasks.details: Evaluate requirements for custom authentication logic. Implement Auth0 Rules or Actions for custom claims or additional validation. Test and verify custom logic works as expected.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test custom Rules or Actions to ensure they properly modify tokens or authentication behavior as expected.

tasks.title: 定義領域模型 (Domain Models) 與倉儲介面 (Repository Interfaces)
tasks.description: 在 `internal/domain` 套件中，為 `Pet`、`HealthLog` 和 `MedicalRecord` 建立 Go 的 struct。為每個模型定義一個 `Repository` 介面，並明確指定所需的 CRUD 方法簽名 (例如：Create, FindByID, Update, Delete)。此層級必須保持純淨，不依賴任何特定的資料庫驅動程式或其他基礎設施。
tasks.details:
1. 在 `internal/domain` 套件中建立領域模型：
   - Pet: {ID, OwnerID, Name, AvatarURL, DOB, Breed, MicrochipID}
   - HealthLog: {ID, PetID, Date, WeightKg, FoodGram, LitterNotes, BehaviourNotes}
   - MedicalRecord: {ID, PetID, Type, Description, Date, NextDueDate, Dosage}

2. 為每個模型定義倉儲介面：
   ```go
   type PetRepository interface {
     Create(ctx context.Context, pet *Pet) error
     FindByID(ctx context.Context, id string) (*Pet, error)
     FindByOwnerID(ctx context.Context, ownerID string) ([]*Pet, error)
     Update(ctx context.Context, pet *Pet) error
     Delete(ctx context.Context, id string) error
   }
   ```
   (為 HealthLogRepository 和 MedicalRecordRepository 建立類似的介面)

3. 確保領域模型和倉儲介面不依賴 MongoDB 或其他基礎設施

4. 記錄每個倉儲方法的預期行為

5. 為後續任務準備 MongoDB 的實作 (將在基礎設施層實作)
tasks.testStrategy: 為領域模型編寫單元測試，以驗證它們包含所有必要的欄位。建立倉儲介面的模擬實作以進行測試。在測試中使用依賴注入，以確保領域層保持純淨。

tasks.title: 實作寵物管理的 Usecase/Service
tasks.description: 在 `internal/usecase` 套件中，建立 `PetUsecase`。此服務將透過其建構函式，接收 `pet.Repository` 介面 (在任務 #3 中定義) 作為依賴。它應實作寵物資料的 CRUD 核心業務邏輯，並由 `Endpoint` 層呼叫。此任務不應包含任何傳輸層或特定資料庫的程式碼。
tasks.details:
1. 在 internal/usecase/pet.go 中建立 PetUsecase 結構體
2. 實作接收 pet.Repository 作為依賴的建構函式
3. 實作核心業務邏輯方法：
   - GetPets() - 列出已認證使用者的所有寵物
   - CreatePet() - 建立新寵物
   - GetPetByID() - 獲取寵物詳細資訊
   - UpdatePet() - 更新寵物詳細資訊
   - DeletePet() - 刪除寵物
4. 實作適當的錯誤處理和驗證邏輯
5. 遵循乾淨架構原則：
   - 無傳輸層依賴 (HTTP、gRPC 等)
   - 無特定資料庫程式碼
   - 專注於業務規則和使用案例
6. 使用 internal/domain 中定義的領域模型
7. 使用 uber-go/zap 實作適當的日誌記錄
tasks.testStrategy:
1. 為每個使用案例方法編寫全面的單元測試
2. 為儲存庫介面使用模擬 (mock)
3. 測試正常路徑和錯誤情境
4. 驗證業務邏輯正確性
5. 確保正確驗證輸入

tasks.title: 實作 MongoDB 倉儲 (Repositories)
tasks.description: 使用 `mongo-driver` 實作在任務 #3 中定義的 `Repository` 介面。這包括在 `internal/repository` 套件中建立資料庫連線邏輯，並為所有領域模型 (Pet, HealthLog, MedicalRecord) 實作 CRUD 方法。此層級負責所有直接的資料庫互動。
tasks.details:
1. 在 `internal/repository` 中建立 MongoDB 連線邏輯
2. 為以下模型實作 Repository 介面：
   - Pet 模型
   - HealthLog 模型
   - MedicalRecord 模型
3. 為每個模型實作 CRUD 操作：
   - 建立 (Create)
   - 讀取 (Read，單一項目及帶分頁的列表)
   - 更新 (Update)
   - 刪除 (Delete)
4. 為列表操作實作基於游標的分頁功能
5. 新增過濾功能（例如：日期範圍、類型）
6. 在適當情況下支援批次操作
7. 確保適當的錯誤處理和 MongoDB 特定的最佳化
tasks.testStrategy:
1. 為每個倉儲實作撰寫單元測試
2. 建立驗證 MongoDB 互動的整合測試
3. 測試分頁和過濾功能
4. 測試錯誤處理情境（連線問題、驗證失敗）
5. 對批次操作進行效能基準測試

tasks.title: Implement Medical Record CRUD API
tasks.description: Create REST API endpoints for managing pet medical records.
tasks.details:
1. Implement endpoints:
   - GET /v1/pets/{id}/medical-records
   - POST /v1/pets/{id}/medical-records
   - PUT /v1/pets/{id}/medical-records/{recordId}
   - DELETE /v1/pets/{id}/medical-records/{recordId}
2. Implement sorting and filtering options
3. Add support for file attachments (store in S3-compatible storage)
4. Implement reminder system for upcoming medical events
5. Use go-kit for service layer implementation
6. Implement rate limiting using golang.org/x/time/rate
tasks.testStrategy: Write unit tests for medical record use cases. Test file upload and download. Verify reminder system functionality.

tasks.title: Setup S3-compatible Storage
tasks.description: Integrate S3-compatible storage (Wasabi/MinIO) for storing pet avatars and medical record attachments.
tasks.details:
1. Set up Wasabi or MinIO account
2. Create necessary buckets for avatars and attachments
3. Implement Go client for S3 using AWS SDK (github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2)
4. Create service for file upload and download
5. Implement file type and size validation
6. Generate signed URLs for secure file access
7. Implement file deletion when associated records are deleted
tasks.testStrategy: Test file upload, download, and deletion. Verify signed URL functionality. Test with various file types and sizes.
